Cloudburst

There is no such things as the cloud... anymore.

We are worried with how centralized the internet has become. This centralization makes the internet more vulnerable. If everything goes well the effects of centralization are unnoticable. Yet, we are curious see how we are affected when something does go wrong in a cloud. Aren't you?

As little as possible. We are privacy nerds, we would very much like to say "we dont collect your data".

Unfortunately, we need some information to make things work:
  • connectivity data may end up in our logs for debugging purposes
  • your current IP address is needed in case of a VPN to talk back to you
All data and log files will be cleared after the event.

We can only block the traffic that goes through our gateway. If some platform depends on another platform behind the scene we cannot block that. Thus, in reallity, the effects are likely worse than we can demonstrate.

The blocklists may not be accurate. We work with both officialy published lists and with lists based on what is announced by the Autonomous Systems of the service provider. Both could be incomplete.
